install.name: Simple Image Holder
install.author: Omar Muhammad
install.description:
Simple Image Holder Module v1.5.12 was installed successfully..
if you like it, you can support it by donating at http://omar84.com/

param.name: file
param.label: File Location
param.description:
Location of File, examples:
Holding Local Files:
images/stories/powered_by.png
images/flash/clock.swf
Holding External Files:
http://cdn.joomla.org/images/logo.png

param.name: width
param.label: Width
param.description: Width of the (image/flash) (in pixles), leave empty to use the default width

param.name: height
param.label: Height
param.description: Height of the (image/flash) (in pixles), leave empty to use the default height

param.name: txt1
param.label: Text Above
param.description: An optional text to put above the (image/flash), leave empty for no text

param.name: txt2
param.label: Text Below
param.description: An optional text to put below the (image/flash), leave empty for no text

param.default: Image Info (use when holding image files: jpg, png, gif, etc..):

param.name: alt
param.label: Alternate Text
param.description: Text to display when mouseover the image, leave empty to disable

param.name: link
param.label: Link
param.description:
Link the image to a webpage, examples:
Internal Links:
administrator/
External Links:
http://google.com
or leave empty for no linking

param.name: page
param.label: Link Type
param.description: when you click the image, it opens the link in either a new window or in the same window

param.name: opacity
param.label: Image Opcaity
param.description: Opacity of Image (integer from 0 to 100), leave empty for a fully opaque image

param.name: opacity2
param.label: Image Opcaity On Mouse Over
param.description: Opacity of Image when the user puts the mouse over it (integer from 0 to 100), leave empty to keep the same opacity

param.name: img_id
param.label: Image Class
param.description: Give a unique Class ID to this image, so that you can style it idivisually in your css file, or leave empty for automatic Class generation (note: the class name must contain no spaces, and must be unique to each copy of this module)

param.default: Flash Info (use when holding flash files: swf):

param.name: name
param.label: Flash Name/ID
param.description: Identifies the Flash movie to the host environment.

param.name: quality
param.label: Flash Quality
param.description: Quality setting to use in the Flash Player.

param.name: loop
param.label: Flash Looping
param.description: Specifies whether the Flash movie repeats indefinitely or stops when it reaches the last frame.

param.name: wmode
param.label: Flash Mode
param.description: Sets the Window Mode property of the Flash movie for transparency, layering, and positioning in the browser.

param.default: Publish by date (Use if you want to publish your file according to dates):

param.name: pubdate
param.label: Enable (Pulblish by date) Option
param.description: use if you want to publish the (image/flash) in a specific date(s)

param.name: pdate
param.label: Start Date
param.description: Date to start publishing the (image/flash), format: dd-mm-yyyy

param.name: udate
param.label: End Date
param.description: Date to end publishing the (image/flash), format: dd-mm-yyyy

param.default: The date should look like this example: 17-5-2009.

If you want the (image/flash) to be published periodically, use 'x' instead of the month or the year, for example, writing: 1-x-2009 as the (start date) will publish the (image/flash) at the first day of every month of 2009, while writing: 14-2-x will publish the (image/flash) at valentine's day every year, writing: 1-x-x will publish the (image/flash) at the start of every month of every year. and the same thing applies for the (end date).

If you leave a date field empty, it will be considered as (always publish) for example, leaving the (start date) empty and writing a date at the (end date) will publish the (image/flash) until the end date, and vice verca.
